image.altText: police vehicles on side of road

props.synopsis: Tasmania Police has opened an investigation into the death of a pedestrian after a body was found on a major highway north of Hobart in the early hours of Saturday morning.

title.children: Body found lying on Brooker Highway treated as suspicious death, police say

image.altText: Motorbike crash on Brooker Highway

props.synopsis: Tasmania's road toll has doubled from the same time last year, police say, as an investigation opens into the circumstances of a two-vehicle crash that led to the death of a motorcyclist on Thursday, and a 27-year-old woman dies after a collision in the state's north.

title.children: Tasmanian road toll doubles from same time last year after two more fatalities

image.altText: a tasmania police badge

props.synopsis: A 75-year-old man has died in hospital after being hit and critically injured by a car in Hobart's CBD 10 days ago.

title.children: Elderly pedestrian dies from injuries after Hobart CBD crash

image.altText: Preparations for Easter at the Greek Orthodox Church in Hobart, 18 April 2025 2025-04-18 10:04:00

props.synopsis: Tasmanians celebrated Good Friday with passion as this year marks a special Easter for Australia's Christian community.

title.children: Why is Good Friday so special this year?

image.altText: Police car and police tape outside a house

props.synopsis: An eight-year-old boy remains in an induced coma after the body of a woman, believed to be his mother, was found in a burnt-out car in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: Boy remains in coma after woman's body found in burnt-out car

image.altText: Peter Dutton in a suit smiles while patting a cow

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton is selling the Coalition's newly announced small business tax package in Sydney this morning, where he's set to tour the Royal Easter Show. Meanwhile, Labor is talking up its proposed changes to penalty rates, which would prevent reductions in weekend rates for lower-paid workers. Follow live.

title.children: Dutton tours Royal Easter Show as Labor vows to protect penalty rates

image.altText: A large burger on a plate with chips

props.synopsis: The policy was touted as a major help for small businesses, but Liberal Leader Peter Dutton has only mentioned it once since his budget reply speech.

title.children: Coalition's tax-free lunch policy sidelined, mentioned just once in campaign

image.altText: Two men sitting at a table with one reaching out a hand to the other

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has hit back at Democrat Senator Chris Van Hollen for meeting with Kilmar Abrego Garcia and insists he will not facilitate Garcia's return from El Salvador, despite the US Supreme Court directing him to.

title.children: Trump calls US senator 'fake' for El Salvador visit to man deported in error

image.altText: Planks of processed timber stacked on metal shelves for in a giant hardware store.

props.synopsis: Do you know where the timber in your local hardware store comes from? The

title.children: Opposition vows to put country of origin stamp on your back deck

image.altText: A photo of a grey overcast sky over mangroves and water.

props.synopsis: Emergency services say they will continue to monitor ex-cyclone Errol as it moves through the Kimberley, bringing welcome rain ahead of the busy tourist season.

title.children: Ex-cyclone Errol 'a dodged bullet' as it crosses Kimberley as tropical low

image.altText: Close up of a feral cat with piercing green eyes looking through green leaves

props.synopsis: Cats pose a real threat to native animals in Australia, but finding a one-size-fits-all approach is proving tricky.

title.children: The great cat catastrophe facing Australia's native wildlife

image.altText: An aerial shot of four people standing around a police car and ambulance parked on a dirt road in thick bush.

props.synopsis: A six-year-old boy who wandered away from family in the Dandenong Ranges has been found by a local mountain-bike rider.

title.children: Local teen finds missing boy found after night lost in Olinda bushland

image.altText: A woman in a red sweater stands outside her house.

props.synopsis: It's April 7 — a week since Thargomindah's levee broke, and nearly the entire township was inundated — and Melinda Byrne is finally returning to her flood-damaged home. A call to her insurance company was even more heartbreaking than the sight of her destroyed possessions.

title.children: Call to insurer even worse than sight of this flood-damaged home

image.altText: a bald man wearing glasses speaking in front of an australian flag

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton says he wants to see more Australians start new businesses under a Coalition federal government.

title.children: Coalition sets target to grow number of small businesses by 350,000

image.altText: Reflection in museum

props.synopsis: Jack joined a social media group to find peer connection. But when he suggested posters could be "a bit misogynistic" the harassment started.

title.children: 'Objectifying women as a starting point': Inside a controversial men-only support group

image.altText: A woman, smiling, in a green shirt, in her kitchen, holding eggs painted red for Easter

props.synopsis: Usually Catholic and Protestant Easter falls a couple of weeks before Eastern Orthodox Easter, but this year all Christians will be celebrating at the same time.

title.children: Rare calendar alignment sees all Christians celebrate Easter together

image.altText: marco rubio in paris

props.synopsis: Secretary of State Marco Rubio says the US will not "continue with this endeavour for weeks and months on end".

title.children: US will abandon Ukraine peace talks in 'matter of days' if no progress

image.altText: A man with a blue apron stands in a room full of packaged chocolate

props.synopsis: Small businesses working over the busy Easter period are counting the cost of rising prices, global economic uncertainty and customers who are becoming more frugal.

title.children: Small businesses feel the pinch amid busy Easter period

image.altText: A young Heath Ledger in the 1999 gritty urban crime thriller Two Hands.

props.synopsis: From real-life stories to new comedies, ditch that $20-per-month streaming service and let us introduce to you the best of film and TV you can watch right now without paying a cent.

title.children: Sick of paying for streaming services? These films and TV series are free

image.altText: Sam Draper leaves the field injured in Bombers vs Eagles AFL match.

props.synopsis: Sam Draper's Achilles injury means Essendon will have no choice but to turn to veteran big man Todd Goldstein, who has been working as a pseudo ruck coach for the club so far this year.

title.children: Bombers forced to rely on 'ruck coach' to play amid fresh injury carnage

image.altText: Dolphins players celebrate jumping on each other

props.synopsis: The Dolphins score seven unanswered tries to come from behind and beat the Melbourne Storm at Lang Park. Earlier, the Bulldogs beat South Sydney in front of a record crowd.

title.children: Dolphins score seven unanswered tries as injury revealed for Origin star

image.altText: Image of deceased sheep along a fenceline.

props.synopsis: Western Queensland graziers are facing devastating livestock losses, with an estimated half a million cattle, sheep and goats dead and a tough road to recovery still ahead.

title.children: Livestock losses across western Queensland reach catastrophic levels

image.altText: The Colosseum in Rome illuminated at night with a large, lit cross in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis misses the Good Friday procession, after nearly dying during a five-week bout with double pneumonia.

title.children: Pope misses Good Friday procession, Vatican yet to confirm other appearances

image.altText: Vladimir Putin and Prabowo Subianto shake hands in front of Indonesian and Russian flags

props.synopsis: While 70 per cent of Australians surveyed hold a "very unfavourable" view of Russia, that's only the case for 6 per cent of Indonesians.

title.children: Russian aircraft in Indonesia 'should not concern us', says expert

image.altText: Cam Green raises his bat with his right hand

props.synopsis: After eight months on the sidelines, Australia's star all-rounder makes a triumphant return to cricket by scoring an unbeaten century for English county side Gloucestershire.

title.children: Green 'proud' after scoring century in first match since back surgery

image.altText: Generic stills of pamphlets with information about sexually transmitted infections, including chlamydia and syphillus.

props.synopsis: Sexual transmitted infections have continued to grow across Australia over the last three decades, with chlamydia, gonorrhoea and syphilis spiking in New South Wales alone. The reasons why are complex, experts say.

title.children: Why exactly are STIs spreading more and more across Australia?

image.altText: Marolon stands on a grassy hill, facing the camera in a white button up and grass kirt. In the backdrop, a lake and mountains.

props.synopsis: One of New Zealand's most celebrated voices has embraced te reo Māori for his new album, arriving during a tumultuous time for Māori rights.

title.children: When Marlon Williams started writing in Māori, his music shifted

image.altText: Two police officers take a man out of police van

props.synopsis: The 41-year-old man had offered to help the woman, 84, carry her shopping home and once inside allegedly assaulted her in Sydney's west.

title.children: Man charged over alleged sexual assault of 84yo woman inside her home

image.altText: Jai Arrow held back by John Sutton in clash with Bulldogs fan

props.synopsis: Jai Arrow downplays a verbal stoush he had with a Bulldogs fan seated inside Stadium Australia after the Rabbitohs' humiliating 32-0 loss.

title.children: Souths star says 'passion got the better of me' after fiery fan confrontation

image.altText: A man holding a phone with data on the screen, two people are boxing in the background.

props.synopsis: Many online fitness programs can claim to build a butt or be perfect for building abs, but looking past marketing terminology to find a program that best suits your health and fitness goals can be challenging.

title.children: What to look for when choosing an online exercise program

image.altText: A close up of a Hesta sign on a wall.

props.synopsis: HESTA won't process super contributions, regular withdraws, investment switches and insurance claims until June, due to a system changeover. Consumer advocates and members have expressed concern about the freeze on funds.

title.children: One of Australia's biggest super funds is freezing services until June

image.altText: Claire Austin who was the victim of an alleged domestic violence attack holds a glass of wine while smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: NSW Police are continuing to investigate the death of Claire Austin, 38, in Sydney's east after she was injured trying to escape an alleged domestic violence incident.

title.children: Community mourns death of another alleged domestic violence victim

image.altText: Ramos Horta Timor leste reuters

props.synopsis: Timor-Leste's President Jose Ramos Horta has said his country's forces could join with China's as long as the activity is "not directed at any perceived hostile entity".

title.children: A close Australian neighbour is open to military drills with China

image.altText: An illustration of a scammer and a robot highfiving while popping out of a phone

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is a scammer's newest tool as experts warn they can generate fake photos, voice clones, phishing emails and fake websites “at an increasingly rapid rate”.

title.children: Microsoft says it blocks 1.6 million bots an hour as scammers latch onto AI

image.altText: William Saville-Kent's captivating illustrations of the reef.

props.synopsis: Striking historic drawings of the Great Barrier Reef found in an old, waterlogged book capture the spell this underwater world has put on people for centuries.

title.children: Alien structures and a sea monster: Dive into the Barrier Reef's enduring mystery
